page.title: 18ARCHAEOLOGY IN LECHLADE
page.content: {FINANCE.}In April 1985 archaeologists fom Oxford University came to Lechlade to excavate in Butlers Field. They ran out of financial backing but fortunately extra grants were made so that the excavations could be completed.{GENERAL INFORMATION.}The archaeologists have known about the site since 1940. Photographs taken from the air showed where the crops were darker, usually big patches or dots close together. The dig was for a {Neolithic Barrow}but an{Anglo Saxon {Cemetery}was also found. So far over 240 graves have been found. This site is believed to be the largest of its kind found in England. The Site Director is Dr. David Miles. There has been great interest shown by the local community and Dr. Miles has given two talks in the Memorial Hall. The Primary School has made a video film.
